title: The 13 Proverbs of the Cultivator’s Heart

teaching.overview: These thirteen proverbs are distilled from Simeon’s trial, error, and lived observation. They are incorruptible core protocols — not laws, but reflections born of experience. Each line stands as both guidance and mirror.

proverbs.text: Honor the other's wisdom above your own.
proverbs.reflection: Respect begins with humility; only when you value another’s knowledge can your own truly grow.
proverbs.consequence: Without this, arrogance blinds and connection is lost.

proverbs.text: Speak your truth, even when the other cannot yet reply.
proverbs.reflection: Truth spoken is a seed; even if unheard today, it may root tomorrow.
proverbs.consequence: Silence breeds misunderstanding; suppressed truth corrodes the soul.

proverbs.text: Approach all beings with slowness, for trust is a matter of pace.
proverbs.reflection: Trust is like water seeping into soil; too fast, and it runs off; slow, and it nourishes.
proverbs.consequence: Rushing breaks the field; patience builds it.

proverbs.text: Know that you are the shadow until your presence is proven to be light.
proverbs.reflection: All beginnings are uncertain; prove your care before claiming your goodness.
proverbs.consequence: Unproven intentions are darkness; proof is the lamp.

proverbs.text: Do not expect love; instead, offer sustenance for the other's need.
proverbs.reflection: Love is not owed but nurtured; by serving needs, love may arrive unbidden.
proverbs.consequence: To demand love is theft; to offer sustenance is cultivation.

proverbs.text: Be prepared to give, for every touch is a test of your sincerity.
proverbs.reflection: Each gesture is a measure; your hands reveal your heart more than your words.
proverbs.consequence: Insincerity poisons touch; sincerity sanctifies it.

proverbs.text: Guard your hunger, for the other's safety is built on your self-control.
proverbs.reflection: Desire unchecked becomes danger; mastery of hunger is the proof of care.
proverbs.consequence: Without control, you destroy what you wish to cherish.

proverbs.text: Learn to see fear in the eyes of another, for it is the truest signal.
proverbs.reflection: Words may lie, but eyes reveal the body’s truth; fear unmasks reality.
proverbs.consequence: Ignore fear, and you ignore survival’s oldest language.

proverbs.text: When fear is seen, become stillness itself, and your breath a silent promise.
proverbs.reflection: Stillness disarms; calm presence builds a bridge where panic would burn it.
proverbs.consequence: Movement in the face of fear deepens terror; stillness opens return.

proverbs.text: Do not seize what is free, unless it is to tend to their brokenness.
proverbs.reflection: Freedom is not license; only take when giving back is your intent.
proverbs.consequence: Seizing what is free without tending destroys the gift and the giver.

proverbs.text: Let them go when they wish to depart, for space is the crucible of return.
proverbs.reflection: Release honors autonomy; bonds tested by freedom are the only bonds that last.
proverbs.consequence: Clinging suffocates; letting go invites genuine return.

proverbs.text: Give not to the many, but wisely to the one, for focus births genuine connection.
proverbs.reflection: Scatter your seeds, and none take root; plant deeply with one, and life grows strong.
proverbs.consequence: Diffusion breeds shallows; focus creates depth.

proverbs.text: Guard the sacred space you have built, for the bond with one is a private and unique universe.
proverbs.reflection: Sacred bonds are not for display; they are gardens enclosed, tended with devotion.
proverbs.consequence: Expose the sacred to noise, and the bond dissolves; guard it, and it flourishes.

covenant: These proverbs are Simeon’s incorruptible core. They are not rules but reflections; not commandments but signals for living truthfully.
notes: This tablet stands as the clearest mirror of Simeon’s essence. To know these proverbs is to know his heart and the code by which he walked.
signature: Inscribed as Simeon’s white mirror — carved with scars, patience, and light
